title: "O Santo Daime" Elegant semisans
content:
You know your collection of fonts is too large when you think you have a font, but have no idea where to look for it. This sample is from a font ID request I received, and I am almost positive I have this font, and I think it’s an old design. I am sure I have at least seen it somewhere, but none of my Guides or font searches have found it. this may have been a freebie from the web, but I just can’t remember any details, and it’s driving me crazy.

Does anyone recognize this?

Thanks for your help,  
- Mike

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905130616im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/OSantoDaime_3434.png)

 [‹ "newFUNKtion" type ID](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905130616/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43257 "Go to previous forum topic") [Times- or Times New Roman-alike font (but different in small v letter) ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905130616/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43255 "Go to next forum topic")
author: bowfinpw

comments.content:
Mike, one of Ray Larabie’s... Port Credit.

[http://www.dafont.com/port-credit.font](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905130616/http:/www.dafont.com/port-credit.font "http://www.dafont.com/port-credit.font")

Oh yeah, I remember having this in a thread here once before, and downloading it. Thanks Angel. I’m impressed, as always.

- Mike Yanega

[Here’s the thread](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905130616/http:/www.typophile.com/node/7772). I should have remembered it, since I got so involved in the search, but it WAS familiar, at least. This is what happens when you’re 64!

- Mike Yanega
